segment.source: Windows 10 servicing options for updates and upgrades (Windows 10)
segment.target: Windows 10 servicing options for updates and upgrades (Windows 10)

segment.source: This article describes the new servicing options available in Windows 10.
segment.target: This article describes the new servicing options available in Windows 10.

segment.source: Windows 10 servicing options for updates and upgrades
segment.target: Windows 10 servicing options for updates and upgrades

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core)
segment.target: Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core)

segment.source: This article describes the new servicing options available in Windows 10 and IoT Core and how they enable enterprises to keep their devices current with the latest feature upgrades.
segment.target: This article describes the new servicing options available in Windows 10 and IoT Core and how they enable enterprises to keep their devices current with the latest feature upgrades.

segment.source: It also covers related topics, such as how enterprises can make better use of Windows Update, and what the new servicing options mean for support lifecycles.
segment.target: It also covers related topics, such as how enterprises can make better use of Windows Update, and what the new servicing options mean for support lifecycles.

segment.source: For Windows 10 current version numbers by servicing option see: Windows 10 release information.
segment.target: For Windows 10 current version numbers by servicing option see: Windows 10 release information.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Several of the figures in this article show multiple feature upgrades of Windows being released by Microsoft over time.
segment.target: Several of the figures in this article show multiple feature upgrades of Windows being released by Microsoft over time.

segment.source: Be aware that these figures were created with dates that were chosen for illustrative clarity, not for release roadmap accuracy, and should not be used for planning purposes.
segment.target: Be aware that these figures were created with dates that were chosen for illustrative clarity, not for release roadmap accuracy, and should not be used for planning purposes.

segment.source: Introduction
segment.target: Introduction

segment.source: In enterprise IT environments, the desire to provide users with the latest technologies needs to be balanced with the need for manageability and cost control.
segment.target: In enterprise IT environments, the desire to provide users with the latest technologies needs to be balanced with the need for manageability and cost control.

segment.source: In the past, many enterprises managed their Windows deployments homogeneously and performed large-scale upgrades to new releases of Windows (often in parallel with large-scale hardware upgrades) about every three to six years.
segment.target: In the past, many enterprises managed their Windows deployments homogeneously and performed large-scale upgrades to new releases of Windows (often in parallel with large-scale hardware upgrades) about every three to six years.

segment.source: Today, the rapid evolution of Windows as a platform for device-like experiences is causing businesses to rethink their upgrade strategies.
segment.target: Today, the rapid evolution of Windows as a platform for device-like experiences is causing businesses to rethink their upgrade strategies.

segment.source: Especially with the release of Windows 10, there are good business reasons to keep a significant portion of your enterprise's devices current with the latest release of Windows.
segment.target: Especially with the release of Windows 10, there are good business reasons to keep a significant portion of your enterprise's devices current with the latest release of Windows.

segment.source: For example, during the development of Windows 10, Microsoft:
segment.target: For example, during the development of Windows 10, Microsoft:

segment.source: Streamlined the Windows product engineering and release cycle so that Microsoft can deliver the features, experiences, and functionality customers want, more quickly than ever.
segment.target: Streamlined the Windows product engineering and release cycle so that Microsoft can deliver the features, experiences, and functionality customers want, more quickly than ever.

segment.source: Created new ways to deliver and install feature upgrades and servicing updates that simplify deployments and on-going management, broaden the base of employees who can be kept current with the latest Windows capabilities and experiences, and lower total cost of ownership.
segment.target: Created new ways to deliver and install feature upgrades and servicing updates that simplify deployments and on-going management, broaden the base of employees who can be kept current with the latest Windows capabilities and experiences, and lower total cost of ownership.

segment.source: Implemented new servicing options – referred to as Current Branch (CB), Current Branch for Business (CBB), and Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB) – that provide pragmatic solutions to keep more devices more current in enterprise environments than was previously possible.
segment.target: Implemented new servicing options – referred to as Current Branch (CB), Current Branch for Business (CBB), and Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB) – that provide pragmatic solutions to keep more devices more current in enterprise environments than was previously possible.

segment.source: The remainder of this article provides additional information about each of these areas.
segment.target: The remainder of this article provides additional information about each of these areas.

segment.source: This article also provides an overview of the planning implications of the three Windows 10 servicing options (summarized in Table 1) so that IT administrators can be well-grounded conceptually before they start a Windows 10 deployment project.
segment.target: This article also provides an overview of the planning implications of the three Windows 10 servicing options (summarized in Table 1) so that IT administrators can be well-grounded conceptually before they start a Windows 10 deployment project.

segment.source: Table 1.
segment.target: Table 1.

segment.source: Streamlined product development and release cycles
segment.target: Streamlined product development and release cycles

segment.source: Product cycles and builds
segment.target: Product cycles and builds

segment.source: The Windows engineering team adds new features and functionality to Windows through product cycles comprised of development, testing, and release phases.
segment.target: The Windows engineering team adds new features and functionality to Windows through product cycles comprised of development, testing, and release phases.

segment.source: Each day during a product cycle, the team compiles the source code for Windows and assembles the output into a build that users can install on their devices.
segment.target: Each day during a product cycle, the team compiles the source code for Windows and assembles the output into a build that users can install on their devices.

segment.source: The first recipients of builds are Microsoft employees who begin what Microsoft calls selfhost testing.
segment.target: The first recipients of builds are Microsoft employees who begin what Microsoft calls selfhost testing.

segment.source: Testing and release prior to Windows 10
segment.target: Testing and release prior to Windows 10

segment.source: Prior to Windows 10, Microsoft issued and extensively tested many builds internally before selecting one for testing outside Microsoft.
segment.target: Prior to Windows 10, Microsoft issued and extensively tested many builds internally before selecting one for testing outside Microsoft.

segment.source: After repeating the external test cycle several times against builds of progressively better quality, the engineering team selected a build to enter the release phase.
segment.target: After repeating the external test cycle several times against builds of progressively better quality, the engineering team selected a build to enter the release phase.

segment.source: At the end of this phase, the team published the build as a new version of Windows – an event referred to as the Release to Manufacturing (RTM) milestone.
segment.target: At the end of this phase, the team published the build as a new version of Windows – an event referred to as the Release to Manufacturing (RTM) milestone.

segment.source: In total, product cycles took between one and three years to complete, with testing and release processes taking up as much as half of the total investment in time.
segment.target: In total, product cycles took between one and three years to complete, with testing and release processes taking up as much as half of the total investment in time.

segment.source: A different approach for Windows 10
segment.target: A different approach for Windows 10

segment.source: In today’s environment, where user expectations frequently are set by device-centric experiences, complete product cycles need to be measured in months, not years.
segment.target: In today’s environment, where user expectations frequently are set by device-centric experiences, complete product cycles need to be measured in months, not years.

segment.source: Additionally, new releases must be made available on a continual basis, and must be deployable with minimal impact on users.
segment.target: Additionally, new releases must be made available on a continual basis, and must be deployable with minimal impact on users.

segment.source: Microsoft designed Windows 10 to meet these requirements by implementing a new approach to innovation development and delivery called Windows as a Service (WaaS).
segment.target: Microsoft designed Windows 10 to meet these requirements by implementing a new approach to innovation development and delivery called Windows as a Service (WaaS).

segment.source: The key to enabling significantly shorter product cycles while maintaining high quality levels is an innovative community-centric approach to testing that Microsoft has implemented for Windows 10.
segment.target: The key to enabling significantly shorter product cycles while maintaining high quality levels is an innovative community-centric approach to testing that Microsoft has implemented for Windows 10.

segment.source: The community, known as Windows Insiders, is comprised of millions of users around the world.
segment.target: The community, known as Windows Insiders, is comprised of millions of users around the world.

segment.source: When Windows Insiders opt in to the community, they test many builds over the course of a product cycle, and provide feedback to Microsoft through an iterative methodology called flighting.
segment.target: When Windows Insiders opt in to the community, they test many builds over the course of a product cycle, and provide feedback to Microsoft through an iterative methodology called flighting.

segment.source: Builds distributed as flights provide the Windows engineering team with significant data regarding how well builds are performing in actual use.
segment.target: Builds distributed as flights provide the Windows engineering team with significant data regarding how well builds are performing in actual use.

segment.source: Flighting with Windows Insiders also enables Microsoft to test builds in much more diverse hardware, application, and networking environments than in the past, and to identify issues far more quickly.
segment.target: Flighting with Windows Insiders also enables Microsoft to test builds in much more diverse hardware, application, and networking environments than in the past, and to identify issues far more quickly.

segment.source: As a result, Microsoft believes that community-focused flighting will enable both a faster pace of innovation delivery, and better public release quality than ever.
segment.target: As a result, Microsoft believes that community-focused flighting will enable both a faster pace of innovation delivery, and better public release quality than ever.

segment.source: Windows 10 release types and cadences
segment.target: Windows 10 release types and cadences

segment.source: Although Microsoft releases flight builds to Windows Insiders, Microsoft will publish two types of Windows 10 releases broadly to the public on an ongoing basis:
segment.target: Although Microsoft releases flight builds to Windows Insiders, Microsoft will publish two types of Windows 10 releases broadly to the public on an ongoing basis:

segment.source: Feature upgrades that install the latest new features, experiences, and capabilities on devices that are already running Windows 10.
segment.target: Feature upgrades that install the latest new features, experiences, and capabilities on devices that are already running Windows 10.

segment.source: Because feature upgrades contain an entire copy of Windows, they are also what customers use to install Windows 10 on existing devices running Windows 7 or Windows 8.1, and on new devices where no operating system is installed.
segment.target: Because feature upgrades contain an entire copy of Windows, they are also what customers use to install Windows 10 on existing devices running Windows 7 or Windows 8.1, and on new devices where no operating system is installed.

segment.source: Servicing updates that focus on the installation of security fixes and other important updates.
segment.target: Servicing updates that focus on the installation of security fixes and other important updates.

segment.source: Microsoft expects to publish an average of two to three new feature upgrades per year, and to publish servicing updates as needed for any feature upgrades that are still in support.
segment.target: Microsoft expects to publish an average of two to three new feature upgrades per year, and to publish servicing updates as needed for any feature upgrades that are still in support.

segment.source: Microsoft will continue publishing servicing updates on Update Tuesday (sometimes referred to as Patch Tuesday).
segment.target: Microsoft will continue publishing servicing updates on Update Tuesday (sometimes referred to as Patch Tuesday).

segment.source: Additionally, Microsoft may publish additional servicing updates for Windows 10 outside the Update Tuesday process when required to address customer needs.
segment.target: Additionally, Microsoft may publish additional servicing updates for Windows 10 outside the Update Tuesday process when required to address customer needs.

segment.source: The cumulative nature of all Windows 10 releases It is important to note that, in order to improve release quality and simplify deployments, all new releases that Microsoft publishes for Windows 10 will be cumulative.
segment.target: The cumulative nature of all Windows 10 releases It is important to note that, in order to improve release quality and simplify deployments, all new releases that Microsoft publishes for Windows 10 will be cumulative.

segment.source: This means new feature upgrades and servicing updates will contain the payloads of all previous releases (in an optimized form to reduce storage and networking requirements), and installing the release on a device will bring it completely up to date.
segment.target: This means new feature upgrades and servicing updates will contain the payloads of all previous releases (in an optimized form to reduce storage and networking requirements), and installing the release on a device will bring it completely up to date.

segment.source: Also, unlike earlier versions of Windows, you cannot install a subset of the contents of a Windows 10 servicing update.
segment.target: Also, unlike earlier versions of Windows, you cannot install a subset of the contents of a Windows 10 servicing update.

segment.source: For example, if a servicing update contains fixes for three security vulnerabilities and one reliability issue, deploying the update will result in the installation of all four fixes.
segment.target: For example, if a servicing update contains fixes for three security vulnerabilities and one reliability issue, deploying the update will result in the installation of all four fixes.

segment.source: New Windows 10 delivery and installation alternatives
segment.target: New Windows 10 delivery and installation alternatives

segment.source: As with earlier releases of Windows, Windows 10 includes support for the deployment of new releases using Windows Update, Windows Server Update Services, System Center Configuration Manager, and third-party configuration management tools.
segment.target: As with earlier releases of Windows, Windows 10 includes support for the deployment of new releases using Windows Update, Windows Server Update Services, System Center Configuration Manager, and third-party configuration management tools.

segment.source: Because of the importance of the Windows as a Service (WaaS) approach to delivering innovations to businesses, and the proven ability of Windows Update to deploy releases quickly and seamlessly to consumers and small businesses, several of the largest investments in Windows 10 focus on enabling broader use of Windows Update within enterprises.
segment.target: Because of the importance of the Windows as a Service (WaaS) approach to delivering innovations to businesses, and the proven ability of Windows Update to deploy releases quickly and seamlessly to consumers and small businesses, several of the largest investments in Windows 10 focus on enabling broader use of Windows Update within enterprises.

segment.source: Windows Update use by consumers and small businesses
segment.target: Windows Update use by consumers and small businesses

segment.source: Since Microsoft introduced the first generation of Windows Update with Windows 95, Windows Update has evolved to become the standard way for consumers and small businesses to help keep devices running Windows secure and running reliably.
segment.target: Since Microsoft introduced the first generation of Windows Update with Windows 95, Windows Update has evolved to become the standard way for consumers and small businesses to help keep devices running Windows secure and running reliably.

segment.source: Almost one billion Windows devices communicate with the Windows Update service on a regular basis.
segment.target: Almost one billion Windows devices communicate with the Windows Update service on a regular basis.

segment.source: The process of downloading and installing updates has evolved to be less and less obtrusive to users.
segment.target: The process of downloading and installing updates has evolved to be less and less obtrusive to users.

segment.source: More recently, Microsoft also has used Windows Update to deliver larger, feature-centric updates, such as the upgrade from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1, and is using Windows Update to upgrade devices running Windows 7 and Windows 8.1 to Windows 10.
segment.target: More recently, Microsoft also has used Windows Update to deliver larger, feature-centric updates, such as the upgrade from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1, and is using Windows Update to upgrade devices running Windows 7 and Windows 8.1 to Windows 10.

segment.source: Windows Update use within enterprises
segment.target: Windows Update use within enterprises

segment.source: Although Windows Update greatly simplifies and accelerates update deployment, enterprises are not using Windows Update as broadly as consumers and small businesses.
segment.target: Although Windows Update greatly simplifies and accelerates update deployment, enterprises are not using Windows Update as broadly as consumers and small businesses.

segment.source: This is largely because Windows Update maintains control over which updates are installed and the timing of installation.
segment.target: This is largely because Windows Update maintains control over which updates are installed and the timing of installation.

segment.source: This makes it difficult for IT administrators to test updates before deployment in their specific environment.
segment.target: This makes it difficult for IT administrators to test updates before deployment in their specific environment.

segment.source: The role of Windows Server Update Services
segment.target: The role of Windows Server Update Services

segment.source: To help address the concerns of IT administrators, Microsoft released Windows Server Update Services in 2005.
segment.target: To help address the concerns of IT administrators, Microsoft released Windows Server Update Services in 2005.

segment.source: Windows Server Update Services enables IT administrators to obtain the updates that Windows Update determines are applicable to the devices in their enterprise, perform additional testing and evaluation on the updates, and select the updates they want to install.
segment.target: Windows Server Update Services enables IT administrators to obtain the updates that Windows Update determines are applicable to the devices in their enterprise, perform additional testing and evaluation on the updates, and select the updates they want to install.

segment.source: Windows Server Update Services also provides IT administrators with an all or nothing way to specify when they want an approved update to be installed.
segment.target: Windows Server Update Services also provides IT administrators with an all or nothing way to specify when they want an approved update to be installed.

segment.source: Because IT administrators ultimately select and install most updates identified by Windows Update, the role of Windows Server Update Services in many enterprises is to provide IT administrators with the additional time they need to gain confidence in the quality of updates prior to deployment.
segment.target: Because IT administrators ultimately select and install most updates identified by Windows Update, the role of Windows Server Update Services in many enterprises is to provide IT administrators with the additional time they need to gain confidence in the quality of updates prior to deployment.

segment.source: New Windows Update capabilities in Windows 10
segment.target: New Windows Update capabilities in Windows 10

segment.source: To enable enterprises to manage more of their devices using Windows Update directly, Windows 10 provides IT administrators with a way to configure devices so that Windows Update will defer new feature upgrade installations until approximately four months after Microsoft first publishes them.
segment.target: To enable enterprises to manage more of their devices using Windows Update directly, Windows 10 provides IT administrators with a way to configure devices so that Windows Update will defer new feature upgrade installations until approximately four months after Microsoft first publishes them.

segment.source: The additional time can be used to perform testing or enable releases to gain additional time in market prior to deployment.
segment.target: The additional time can be used to perform testing or enable releases to gain additional time in market prior to deployment.

segment.source: At the end of each approximately four month period, Microsoft executes a set of processes that require no action from enterprise IT administrators.
segment.target: At the end of each approximately four month period, Microsoft executes a set of processes that require no action from enterprise IT administrators.

segment.source: First, Microsoft creates new installation media for the feature upgrade by combining the original installation media with all the servicing updates published by Microsoft since the original media’s release.
segment.target: First, Microsoft creates new installation media for the feature upgrade by combining the original installation media with all the servicing updates published by Microsoft since the original media’s release.

segment.source: This reduces the time it can take to install a feature upgrade on a device.
segment.target: This reduces the time it can take to install a feature upgrade on a device.

segment.source: Second, Microsoft republishes the new media to Windows Update with targeting instructions that state (in effect) “install this media on devices that are configured for deferred installation of new feature upgrades.”
segment.target: Second, Microsoft republishes the new media to Windows Update with targeting instructions that state (in effect) “install this media on devices that are configured for deferred installation of new feature upgrades.”

segment.source: At this point, devices configured to defer installation will begin receiving and installing the feature upgrade automatically.
segment.target: At this point, devices configured to defer installation will begin receiving and installing the feature upgrade automatically.

segment.source: The role of Windows Update for Business
segment.target: The role of Windows Update for Business

segment.source: Although Windows 10 will enable IT administrators to defer installation of new feature upgrades using Windows Update, enterprises may also want additional control over how and when Windows Update installs releases.
segment.target: Although Windows 10 will enable IT administrators to defer installation of new feature upgrades using Windows Update, enterprises may also want additional control over how and when Windows Update installs releases.

segment.source: With this need in mind, Microsoft announced Windows Update for Business in May of 2015.
segment.target: With this need in mind, Microsoft announced Windows Update for Business in May of 2015.

segment.source: Microsoft designed Windows Update for Business to provide IT administrators with additional Windows Update-centric management capabilities, such as the ability to deploy updates to groups of devices and to define maintenance windows for installing releases.
segment.target: Microsoft designed Windows Update for Business to provide IT administrators with additional Windows Update-centric management capabilities, such as the ability to deploy updates to groups of devices and to define maintenance windows for installing releases.

segment.source: This article will be updated with additional information about the role of Windows Update for Business in servicing Windows 10 devices as it becomes available.
segment.target: This article will be updated with additional information about the role of Windows Update for Business in servicing Windows 10 devices as it becomes available.

segment.source: Windows 10 servicing options
segment.target: Windows 10 servicing options

segment.source: Historically, because of the length of time between releases of new Windows versions, and the relatively low number of enterprise devices that were upgraded to newer versions of Windows during their deployment lifetimes, most IT administrators defined servicing as installing the updates that Microsoft published every month.
segment.target: Historically, because of the length of time between releases of new Windows versions, and the relatively low number of enterprise devices that were upgraded to newer versions of Windows during their deployment lifetimes, most IT administrators defined servicing as installing the updates that Microsoft published every month.

segment.source: Looking forward, because Microsoft will be publishing new feature upgrades on a continual basis, servicing will also include (on some portion of an enterprise's devices) installing new feature upgrades as they become available.
segment.target: Looking forward, because Microsoft will be publishing new feature upgrades on a continual basis, servicing will also include (on some portion of an enterprise's devices) installing new feature upgrades as they become available.

segment.source: In fact, when planning to deploy Windows 10 on a device, one of the most important questions for IT administrators to ask is, “What should happen to this device when Microsoft publishes a new feature upgrade?”
segment.target: In fact, when planning to deploy Windows 10 on a device, one of the most important questions for IT administrators to ask is, “What should happen to this device when Microsoft publishes a new feature upgrade?”

segment.source: This is because Microsoft designed Windows 10 to provide businesses with multiple servicing options, centered on enabling different rates of feature upgrade adoption.
segment.target: This is because Microsoft designed Windows 10 to provide businesses with multiple servicing options, centered on enabling different rates of feature upgrade adoption.

segment.source: In particular, IT administrators can configure Windows 10 devices to:
segment.target: In particular, IT administrators can configure Windows 10 devices to:

segment.source: Receive feature upgrades immediately after Microsoft makes them available publicly, so that users gain access to new features, experiences, and functionality as soon as possible.
segment.target: Receive feature upgrades immediately after Microsoft makes them available publicly, so that users gain access to new features, experiences, and functionality as soon as possible.

segment.source: For more information, see Immediate feature upgrade installation with Current Branch (CB) servicing.
segment.target: For more information, see Immediate feature upgrade installation with Current Branch (CB) servicing.

segment.source: Defer receiving feature upgrades for a period of approximately four months after Microsoft makes them available publicly, to provide IT administrators with time to perform pre-deployment testing and provide feature upgrades releases with additional time-in-market to mature.
segment.target: Defer receiving feature upgrades for a period of approximately four months after Microsoft makes them available publicly, to provide IT administrators with time to perform pre-deployment testing and provide feature upgrades releases with additional time-in-market to mature.

segment.source: For more information, see Deferred feature upgrade installation with Current Branch for Business (CBB) servicing.
segment.target: For more information, see Deferred feature upgrade installation with Current Branch for Business (CBB) servicing.

segment.source: Receive only servicing updates for the duration of their Windows 10 deployment in order to reduce the number of non-essential changes made to the device.
segment.target: Receive only servicing updates for the duration of their Windows 10 deployment in order to reduce the number of non-essential changes made to the device.

segment.source: For more information, see Install servicing updates only by using Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB) servicing.
segment.target: For more information, see Install servicing updates only by using Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB) servicing.

segment.source: The breakout of a company’s devices by the categories above is likely to vary significantly by industry and other factors.
segment.target: The breakout of a company’s devices by the categories above is likely to vary significantly by industry and other factors.

segment.source: What is most important is that companies can decide what works best for them and can choose different options for different devices.
segment.target: What is most important is that companies can decide what works best for them and can choose different options for different devices.

segment.source: Plan for Windows 10 deployment
segment.target: Plan for Windows 10 deployment

segment.source: The remainder of this article focuses on the description of the three options outlined above, and their planning implications, in more detail.
segment.target: The remainder of this article focuses on the description of the three options outlined above, and their planning implications, in more detail.

segment.source: In practice, IT administrators have to focus on two areas when planning a Windows 10 device deployment:
segment.target: In practice, IT administrators have to focus on two areas when planning a Windows 10 device deployment:

segment.source: When should new feature upgrades be deployed?
segment.target: When should new feature upgrades be deployed?

segment.source: Should the device install new feature upgrades when they are published by Microsoft?
segment.target: Should the device install new feature upgrades when they are published by Microsoft?

segment.source: If so, should installation occur immediately or on a deferred basis?
segment.target: If so, should installation occur immediately or on a deferred basis?

segment.source: How will releases be installed on devices?
segment.target: How will releases be installed on devices?

segment.source: Will Windows Update or Windows Server Update Services be used to install new releases, or will installation be performed using a configuration management system such as Configuration Manager?
segment.target: Will Windows Update or Windows Server Update Services be used to install new releases, or will installation be performed using a configuration management system such as Configuration Manager?

segment.source: The content that follows will provide IT administrators with the context needed to understand why these areas are pivotal, and the choices available to them.
segment.target: The content that follows will provide IT administrators with the context needed to understand why these areas are pivotal, and the choices available to them.

segment.source: How Microsoft releases Windows 10 feature upgrades
segment.target: How Microsoft releases Windows 10 feature upgrades

segment.source: When it is time to release a build as a new feature upgrade for Windows 10, Microsoft performs several processes in sequence.
segment.target: When it is time to release a build as a new feature upgrade for Windows 10, Microsoft performs several processes in sequence.

segment.source: The first process involves creating either one or two servicing branches in a source code management system.
segment.target: The first process involves creating either one or two servicing branches in a source code management system.

segment.source: These branches (shown in Figure 1) are required to produce feature upgrade installation media and servicing update packages that can be deployed on different Windows 10 editions, running in different configurations.
segment.target: These branches (shown in Figure 1) are required to produce feature upgrade installation media and servicing update packages that can be deployed on different Windows 10 editions, running in different configurations.

segment.source: figure 1
segment.target: figure 1

segment.source: Figure 1.
segment.target: Figure 1.

segment.source: Feature upgrades and servicing branches
segment.target: Feature upgrades and servicing branches

segment.source: In all cases, Microsoft creates a servicing branch (referred to in Figure 1 as Servicing Branch 1) that is used to produce releases for approximately one year (although the lifetime of the branch will ultimately depend on when Microsoft publishes subsequent feature upgrade releases).
segment.target: In all cases, Microsoft creates a servicing branch (referred to in Figure 1 as Servicing Branch 1) that is used to produce releases for approximately one year (although the lifetime of the branch will ultimately depend on when Microsoft publishes subsequent feature upgrade releases).

segment.source: If Microsoft has selected the feature upgrade to receive long-term servicing-only support, Microsoft also creates a second servicing branch (referred to in Figure 1 as Servicing Branch 2) that is used to produce servicing update releases for up to 10 years.
segment.target: If Microsoft has selected the feature upgrade to receive long-term servicing-only support, Microsoft also creates a second servicing branch (referred to in Figure 1 as Servicing Branch 2) that is used to produce servicing update releases for up to 10 years.

segment.source: As shown in Figure 2, when Microsoft publishes a new feature upgrade, Servicing Branch 1 is used to produce the various forms of media needed by OEMs, businesses, and consumers to install Windows 10 Home, Pro, Education, and Enterprise editions.
segment.target: As shown in Figure 2, when Microsoft publishes a new feature upgrade, Servicing Branch 1 is used to produce the various forms of media needed by OEMs, businesses, and consumers to install Windows 10 Home, Pro, Education, and Enterprise editions.

segment.source: Microsoft also produces the files needed by Windows Update to distribute and install the feature upgrade, along with targeting information that instructs Windows Update to only install the files on devices configured for immediate installation of feature upgrades.
segment.target: Microsoft also produces the files needed by Windows Update to distribute and install the feature upgrade, along with targeting information that instructs Windows Update to only install the files on devices configured for immediate installation of feature upgrades.

segment.source: figure 2
segment.target: figure 2

segment.source: Figure 2.
segment.target: Figure 2.

segment.source: Producing feature upgrades from servicing branches
segment.target: Producing feature upgrades from servicing branches

segment.source: Approximately four months after publishing the feature upgrade, Microsoft uses Servicing Branch 1 again to republish updated installation media for Windows 10 Pro, Education, and Enterprise editions.
segment.target: Approximately four months after publishing the feature upgrade, Microsoft uses Servicing Branch 1 again to republish updated installation media for Windows 10 Pro, Education, and Enterprise editions.

segment.source: The updated media contains the exact same feature upgrade as contained in the original media except Microsoft also includes all the servicing updates that were published since the feature upgrade was first made available.
segment.target: The updated media contains the exact same feature upgrade as contained in the original media except Microsoft also includes all the servicing updates that were published since the feature upgrade was first made available.

segment.source: This enables the feature upgrade to be installed on a device more quickly, and in a way that is potentially less obtrusive to users.
segment.target: This enables the feature upgrade to be installed on a device more quickly, and in a way that is potentially less obtrusive to users.

segment.source: Concurrently, Microsoft also changes the way the feature upgrade is published in the Windows Update service.
segment.target: Concurrently, Microsoft also changes the way the feature upgrade is published in the Windows Update service.

segment.source: In particular, the files used by Windows Update to distribute and install the feature upgrade are refreshed with the updated versions, and the targeting instructions are changed so that the updated feature upgrade will now be installed on devices configured for deferred installation of feature upgrades.
segment.target: In particular, the files used by Windows Update to distribute and install the feature upgrade are refreshed with the updated versions, and the targeting instructions are changed so that the updated feature upgrade will now be installed on devices configured for deferred installation of feature upgrades.

segment.source: How Microsoft publishes the Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB Edition
segment.target: How Microsoft publishes the Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB Edition

segment.source: If Microsoft has selected the feature upgrade to receive long-term servicing support, Servicing Branch 2 is used to publish the media needed to install the Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB edition.
segment.target: If Microsoft has selected the feature upgrade to receive long-term servicing support, Servicing Branch 2 is used to publish the media needed to install the Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB edition.

segment.source: The time between releases of feature upgrades with long-term servicing support will vary between one and three years, and is strongly influenced by input from customers regarding the readiness of the release for long-term enterprise deployment.
segment.target: The time between releases of feature upgrades with long-term servicing support will vary between one and three years, and is strongly influenced by input from customers regarding the readiness of the release for long-term enterprise deployment.

segment.source: Figure 2 shows the Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB edition being published at the same time as the other Windows 10 editions, which mirrors the way editions were actually published for Windows 10 in July of 2015.
segment.target: Figure 2 shows the Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB edition being published at the same time as the other Windows 10 editions, which mirrors the way editions were actually published for Windows 10 in July of 2015.

segment.source: It is important to note that this media is never published to Windows Update for deployment.
segment.target: It is important to note that this media is never published to Windows Update for deployment.

segment.source: Installations of the Enterprise LTSB edition on devices must be performed another way.
segment.target: Installations of the Enterprise LTSB edition on devices must be performed another way.

segment.source: How Microsoft releases Windows 10 servicing updates
segment.target: How Microsoft releases Windows 10 servicing updates

segment.source: As shown in Figure 3, servicing branches are also used by Microsoft to produce servicing updates containing fixes for security vulnerabilities and other important issues.
segment.target: As shown in Figure 3, servicing branches are also used by Microsoft to produce servicing updates containing fixes for security vulnerabilities and other important issues.

segment.source: Servicing updates are published in a way that determines the Windows 10 editions on which they can be installed.
segment.target: Servicing updates are published in a way that determines the Windows 10 editions on which they can be installed.

segment.source: For example, servicing updates produced from a given servicing branch can only be installed on devices running a Windows 10 edition produced from the same servicing branch.
segment.target: For example, servicing updates produced from a given servicing branch can only be installed on devices running a Windows 10 edition produced from the same servicing branch.

segment.source: In addition, because Windows 10 Home does not support deferred installation of feature upgrades, servicing updates produced from Servicing Branch 1 are targeted at devices running Windows 10 Home only until Microsoft publishes feature upgrades for deferred installation.
segment.target: In addition, because Windows 10 Home does not support deferred installation of feature upgrades, servicing updates produced from Servicing Branch 1 are targeted at devices running Windows 10 Home only until Microsoft publishes feature upgrades for deferred installation.

segment.source: figure 3
segment.target: figure 3

segment.source: Figure 3.
segment.target: Figure 3.

segment.source: Producing servicing updates from servicing branches
segment.target: Producing servicing updates from servicing branches

segment.source: Release installation alternatives
segment.target: Release installation alternatives

segment.source: When IT administrators select Windows Update and/or Windows Server Update Services to deploy feature upgrades and servicing updates, Windows 10 and Windows Update will determine and deploy the correct releases for each of the three servicing options at the appropriate times.
segment.target: When IT administrators select Windows Update and/or Windows Server Update Services to deploy feature upgrades and servicing updates, Windows 10 and Windows Update will determine and deploy the correct releases for each of the three servicing options at the appropriate times.

segment.source: If there are multiple feature upgrades receiving long-term servicing support at the same time, Windows Update will select updates for each device that are appropriate for the feature upgrades they are running.
segment.target: If there are multiple feature upgrades receiving long-term servicing support at the same time, Windows Update will select updates for each device that are appropriate for the feature upgrades they are running.

segment.source: When IT administrators manage deployments of feature upgrades and servicing updates directly with configuration management products such as Configuration Manager, they are responsible for the timing of installation of both feature upgrades and servicing updates.
segment.target: When IT administrators manage deployments of feature upgrades and servicing updates directly with configuration management products such as Configuration Manager, they are responsible for the timing of installation of both feature upgrades and servicing updates.

segment.source: It is important to note that until IT administrators install a new servicing update, devices may remain exposed to security vulnerabilities.
segment.target: It is important to note that until IT administrators install a new servicing update, devices may remain exposed to security vulnerabilities.

segment.source: Therefore, when managing deployments directly, IT administrators should deploy new servicing updates as soon as possible.
segment.target: Therefore, when managing deployments directly, IT administrators should deploy new servicing updates as soon as possible.

segment.source: Servicing options and servicing branch designations
segment.target: Servicing options and servicing branch designations

segment.source: Servicing options have several different attributes that affect deployment planning decisions.
segment.target: Servicing options have several different attributes that affect deployment planning decisions.

segment.source: For example, each servicing option:
segment.target: For example, each servicing option:

segment.source: Is supported on a selected set of Windows 10 editions (and no Windows 10 edition supports all three servicing options).
segment.target: Is supported on a selected set of Windows 10 editions (and no Windows 10 edition supports all three servicing options).

segment.source: Has a policy that determines the periods of time during which Microsoft will produce servicing updates for a given feature upgrade.
segment.target: Has a policy that determines the periods of time during which Microsoft will produce servicing updates for a given feature upgrade.

segment.source: Has a policy that determines when devices being managed by Windows Update or Windows Server Update Services will install new feature upgrades when they become available from Microsoft.
segment.target: Has a policy that determines when devices being managed by Windows Update or Windows Server Update Services will install new feature upgrades when they become available from Microsoft.

segment.source: Because the servicing lifetime of a feature upgrade typically ends when the servicing lifetime of the subsequent feature upgrade begins, the length of servicing lifetimes will also vary.
segment.target: Because the servicing lifetime of a feature upgrade typically ends when the servicing lifetime of the subsequent feature upgrade begins, the length of servicing lifetimes will also vary.

segment.source: To simplify referring to these ranges, Microsoft created servicing branch designations for each of the three time range/servicing branch combinations.
segment.target: To simplify referring to these ranges, Microsoft created servicing branch designations for each of the three time range/servicing branch combinations.

segment.source: The designations are Current Branch (CB), Current Branch for Business (CBB), and Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB).
segment.target: The designations are Current Branch (CB), Current Branch for Business (CBB), and Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB).

segment.source: Because there is a one-to-one mapping between servicing options and servicing branch designations, Microsoft occasionally refers to servicing options using servicing branch-centric terminology.
segment.target: Because there is a one-to-one mapping between servicing options and servicing branch designations, Microsoft occasionally refers to servicing options using servicing branch-centric terminology.

segment.source: The following sections describe servicing options and servicing branch designations, including terminology, servicing lifetime policies, upgrade behavior, and edition support, in more detail.
segment.target: The following sections describe servicing options and servicing branch designations, including terminology, servicing lifetime policies, upgrade behavior, and edition support, in more detail.

segment.source: Service lifetime and feature upgrade installation paths
segment.target: Service lifetime and feature upgrade installation paths

segment.source: Although Microsoft is currently planning to release approximately two to three feature upgrades per year, the actual frequency and timing of releases will vary.
segment.target: Although Microsoft is currently planning to release approximately two to three feature upgrades per year, the actual frequency and timing of releases will vary.

segment.source: Because the servicing lifetimes of feature upgrades typically end when the servicing lifetimes of other, subsequent feature upgrades begin, the lengths of servicing lifetimes will also vary.
segment.target: Because the servicing lifetimes of feature upgrades typically end when the servicing lifetimes of other, subsequent feature upgrades begin, the lengths of servicing lifetimes will also vary.

segment.source: figure 4
segment.target: figure 4

segment.source: Figure 4.
segment.target: Figure 4.

segment.source: Example release cadence across multiple feature upgrades
segment.target: Example release cadence across multiple feature upgrades

segment.source: To show the variability of servicing lifetimes, and show the paths that feature upgrade installations will take when Windows Update and Windows Server Update Services are used for deployments, Figure 4 contains three feature upgrade releases (labeled X, Y, and Z) and their associated servicing branches.
segment.target: To show the variability of servicing lifetimes, and show the paths that feature upgrade installations will take when Windows Update and Windows Server Update Services are used for deployments, Figure 4 contains three feature upgrade releases (labeled X, Y, and Z) and their associated servicing branches.

segment.source: The time period between publishing X and Y is four months, and the time period between publishing Y and Z is six months.
segment.target: The time period between publishing X and Y is four months, and the time period between publishing Y and Z is six months.

segment.source: X and Z have long-term servicing support, and Y has shorter-term servicing support only.
segment.target: X and Z have long-term servicing support, and Y has shorter-term servicing support only.

segment.source: The same underlying figure will be used in subsequent figures to show all three servicing options in detail.
segment.target: The same underlying figure will be used in subsequent figures to show all three servicing options in detail.

segment.source: It is important to note that Figure 4 is provided for illustration of servicing concepts only and should not be used for actual Windows 10 release planning.
segment.target: It is important to note that Figure 4 is provided for illustration of servicing concepts only and should not be used for actual Windows 10 release planning.

segment.source: To simplify the servicing lifetime and feature upgrade behavior explanations that follow, this document refers to branch designations for a specific feature upgrade as the +0 versions, the designations for the feature upgrade after the +0 version as the +1 (or successor) versions, and the designation for the feature upgrade after the +1 version as the +2 (or second successor) versions.
segment.target: To simplify the servicing lifetime and feature upgrade behavior explanations that follow, this document refers to branch designations for a specific feature upgrade as the +0 versions, the designations for the feature upgrade after the +0 version as the +1 (or successor) versions, and the designation for the feature upgrade after the +1 version as the +2 (or second successor) versions.

segment.source: Immediate feature upgrade installation with Current Branch (CB) servicing As shown in Figure 5, the Current Branch (CB) designation refers to Servicing Branch 1 during the period that starts when Microsoft publishes a feature upgrade targeted for devices configured for immediate installation and ends when Microsoft publishes the successor feature upgrade targeted for devices configured for immediate installation.
segment.target: Immediate feature upgrade installation with Current Branch (CB) servicing As shown in Figure 5, the Current Branch (CB) designation refers to Servicing Branch 1 during the period that starts when Microsoft publishes a feature upgrade targeted for devices configured for immediate installation and ends when Microsoft publishes the successor feature upgrade targeted for devices configured for immediate installation.

segment.source: figure 5
segment.target: figure 5

segment.source: Figure 5.
segment.target: Figure 5.

segment.source: Immediate installation with Current Branch Servicing
segment.target: Immediate installation with Current Branch Servicing

segment.source: The role of Servicing Branch 1 during the CB period is to produce feature upgrades and servicing updates for Windows 10 devices configured for immediate installation of new feature upgrades.
segment.target: The role of Servicing Branch 1 during the CB period is to produce feature upgrades and servicing updates for Windows 10 devices configured for immediate installation of new feature upgrades.

segment.source: Microsoft refers to devices configured this way as being serviced from CBs.
segment.target: Microsoft refers to devices configured this way as being serviced from CBs.

segment.source: The Windows 10 editions that support servicing from CBs are Home, Pro, Education, and Enterprise.
segment.target: The Windows 10 editions that support servicing from CBs are Home, Pro, Education, and Enterprise.

segment.source: The Current Branch designation is intended to reflect the fact that devices serviced using this approach will be kept as current as possible with respect to the latest Windows 10 feature upgrade release.
segment.target: The Current Branch designation is intended to reflect the fact that devices serviced using this approach will be kept as current as possible with respect to the latest Windows 10 feature upgrade release.

segment.source: Windows 10 Home supports Windows Update for release deployment.
segment.target: Windows 10 Home supports Windows Update for release deployment.

segment.source: Windows 10 editions (Pro, Education, and Enterprise) support Windows Update, Windows Server Update Services, Configuration Manager, and other configuration management systems:
segment.target: Windows 10 editions (Pro, Education, and Enterprise) support Windows Update, Windows Server Update Services, Configuration Manager, and other configuration management systems:

segment.source: When IT administrators use Windows Update to manage deployments, devices will receive new feature upgrades and servicing updates as soon as they are published by Microsoft in the Windows Update service, targeted to devices configured for immediate feature upgrade installation.
segment.target: When IT administrators use Windows Update to manage deployments, devices will receive new feature upgrades and servicing updates as soon as they are published by Microsoft in the Windows Update service, targeted to devices configured for immediate feature upgrade installation.

segment.source: When devices are being managed by using Windows Server Update Services, the same workflows are executed as with Windows Update except IT administrators must approve releases before installations begin.
segment.target: When devices are being managed by using Windows Server Update Services, the same workflows are executed as with Windows Update except IT administrators must approve releases before installations begin.

segment.source: When using configuration management systems such as Configuration Manager to manage deployments, IT administrators can obtain installation media from Microsoft and deploy new feature upgrades immediately by using standard change control processes.
segment.target: When using configuration management systems such as Configuration Manager to manage deployments, IT administrators can obtain installation media from Microsoft and deploy new feature upgrades immediately by using standard change control processes.

segment.source: IT administrators who use configuration management systems should also make sure to obtain and deploy all servicing updates published by Microsoft as soon as possible.
segment.target: IT administrators who use configuration management systems should also make sure to obtain and deploy all servicing updates published by Microsoft as soon as possible.

segment.source: It is important to note that devices serviced from CBs must install two to three feature upgrades per year to remain current and continue to receive servicing updates.
segment.target: It is important to note that devices serviced from CBs must install two to three feature upgrades per year to remain current and continue to receive servicing updates.

segment.source: Deferred feature upgrade installation with Current Branch for Business (CBB) servicing As shown in Figure 6, the Current Branch for Business (CBB) designation refers to Servicing Branch 1 during the period that starts when Microsoft republishes a feature upgrade targeted for devices configured for deferred installation and ends when Microsoft republishes the second successor feature upgrade targeted for devices configured for deferred installation.
segment.target: Deferred feature upgrade installation with Current Branch for Business (CBB) servicing As shown in Figure 6, the Current Branch for Business (CBB) designation refers to Servicing Branch 1 during the period that starts when Microsoft republishes a feature upgrade targeted for devices configured for deferred installation and ends when Microsoft republishes the second successor feature upgrade targeted for devices configured for deferred installation.

segment.source: figure 6
segment.target: figure 6

segment.source: Figure 6.
segment.target: Figure 6.

segment.source: Deferred installation with Current Branch for Business Servicing
segment.target: Deferred installation with Current Branch for Business Servicing

segment.source: The role of Servicing Branch 1 during the CBB period is to produce feature upgrades and servicing updates for Windows 10 devices configured for deferred installation of new feature upgrades.
segment.target: The role of Servicing Branch 1 during the CBB period is to produce feature upgrades and servicing updates for Windows 10 devices configured for deferred installation of new feature upgrades.

segment.source: Microsoft refers to devices configured this way as being serviced from CBBs.
segment.target: Microsoft refers to devices configured this way as being serviced from CBBs.

segment.source: The Windows 10 editions that support servicing from CBBs are Pro, Education, and Enterprise.
segment.target: The Windows 10 editions that support servicing from CBBs are Pro, Education, and Enterprise.

segment.source: The Current Branch for Business designation is intended to reflect the fact that many businesses require IT administrators to test feature upgrades prior to deployment, and servicing devices from CBBs is a pragmatic solution for businesses with testing constraints to remain as current as possible.
segment.target: The Current Branch for Business designation is intended to reflect the fact that many businesses require IT administrators to test feature upgrades prior to deployment, and servicing devices from CBBs is a pragmatic solution for businesses with testing constraints to remain as current as possible.

segment.source: Windows 10 (Pro, Education, and Enterprise editions) support release deployment by using Windows Update, Windows Server Update Services, Configuration Manager, and other configuration management systems:
segment.target: Windows 10 (Pro, Education, and Enterprise editions) support release deployment by using Windows Update, Windows Server Update Services, Configuration Manager, and other configuration management systems:

segment.source: When IT administrators use Windows Update to manage deployments, devices will receive new feature upgrades and servicing updates as soon as they are published by Microsoft in the Windows Update service, targeted to devices configured for deferred feature upgrade installation.
segment.target: When IT administrators use Windows Update to manage deployments, devices will receive new feature upgrades and servicing updates as soon as they are published by Microsoft in the Windows Update service, targeted to devices configured for deferred feature upgrade installation.

segment.source: It is important to note that, even when devices are configured to defer installations, all servicing updates that are applicable to the feature upgrade that is running on a device will be installed immediately after being published by Microsoft in the Windows Update service.
segment.target: It is important to note that, even when devices are configured to defer installations, all servicing updates that are applicable to the feature upgrade that is running on a device will be installed immediately after being published by Microsoft in the Windows Update service.

segment.source: When devices are being managed through Windows Server Update Services, the same workflows are executed as with Windows Update except IT administrators must approve releases before installations begin.
segment.target: When devices are being managed through Windows Server Update Services, the same workflows are executed as with Windows Update except IT administrators must approve releases before installations begin.

segment.source: When using configuration management systems such as Configuration Manager to manage deployments, IT administrators can obtain media published for deferred installation from Microsoft and deploy new feature upgrades by using standard change control processes.
segment.target: When using configuration management systems such as Configuration Manager to manage deployments, IT administrators can obtain media published for deferred installation from Microsoft and deploy new feature upgrades by using standard change control processes.

segment.source: When deferring feature upgrade installations, IT administrators should still deploy all applicable servicing updates as soon as they become available from Microsoft.
segment.target: When deferring feature upgrade installations, IT administrators should still deploy all applicable servicing updates as soon as they become available from Microsoft.

segment.source: Microsoft designed Windows 10 servicing lifetime policies so that CBBs will receive servicing updates for approximately twice as many months as CBs.
segment.target: Microsoft designed Windows 10 servicing lifetime policies so that CBBs will receive servicing updates for approximately twice as many months as CBs.

segment.source: This enables two CBBs to receive servicing support at the same time, which provides businesses with more flexibility when deploying new feature upgrades.
segment.target: This enables two CBBs to receive servicing support at the same time, which provides businesses with more flexibility when deploying new feature upgrades.

segment.source: That said, it is important to note that Microsoft will not produce servicing updates for a feature upgrade after its corresponding CBB reaches the end of its servicing lifetime.
segment.target: That said, it is important to note that Microsoft will not produce servicing updates for a feature upgrade after its corresponding CBB reaches the end of its servicing lifetime.

segment.source: This means that feature upgrade deployments cannot be extended indefinitely and IT administrators should ensure that they deploy newer feature upgrades onto devices before CBBs end.
segment.target: This means that feature upgrade deployments cannot be extended indefinitely and IT administrators should ensure that they deploy newer feature upgrades onto devices before CBBs end.

segment.source: Install servicing updates only by using Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB) servicing
segment.target: Install servicing updates only by using Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB) servicing

segment.source: As shown in Figure 7, the Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB) designation refers to Servicing Branch 2 from beginning to end.
segment.target: As shown in Figure 7, the Long-Term Servicing Branch (LTSB) designation refers to Servicing Branch 2 from beginning to end.

segment.source: LTSBs begin when a feature upgrade with long-term support is published by Microsoft and end after 10 years.
segment.target: LTSBs begin when a feature upgrade with long-term support is published by Microsoft and end after 10 years.

segment.source: It is important to note that only the Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB edition supports long-term servicing, and there are important differences between this edition and other Windows 10 editions regarding upgradability and feature set (described below in the Considerations when configuring devices for servicing updates only section).
segment.target: It is important to note that only the Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB edition supports long-term servicing, and there are important differences between this edition and other Windows 10 editions regarding upgradability and feature set (described below in the Considerations when configuring devices for servicing updates only section).

segment.source: figure 7
segment.target: figure 7

segment.source: Figure 7.
segment.target: Figure 7.

segment.source: Servicing updates only using LTSB Servicing
segment.target: Servicing updates only using LTSB Servicing

segment.source: The role of LTSBs is to produce servicing updates for devices running Windows 10 configured to install servicing updates only.
segment.target: The role of LTSBs is to produce servicing updates for devices running Windows 10 configured to install servicing updates only.

segment.source: Devices configured this way are referred to as being serviced from LTSBs.
segment.target: Devices configured this way are referred to as being serviced from LTSBs.

segment.source: The Long-Term Servicing Branch designation is intended to reflect the fact that this servicing option is intended for scenarios where changes to software running on devices must be limited to essential updates (such as those for security vulnerabilities and other important issues) for the duration of deployments.
segment.target: The Long-Term Servicing Branch designation is intended to reflect the fact that this servicing option is intended for scenarios where changes to software running on devices must be limited to essential updates (such as those for security vulnerabilities and other important issues) for the duration of deployments.

segment.source: Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB supports release deployment by using Windows Update, Windows Server Update Services, Configuration Manager, and other configuration management systems:
segment.target: Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB supports release deployment by using Windows Update, Windows Server Update Services, Configuration Manager, and other configuration management systems:

segment.source: When IT administrators use Windows Update to manage deployments, Windows Update will install only servicing updates, and do so as soon as they are published by Microsoft in the Windows Update service.
segment.target: When IT administrators use Windows Update to manage deployments, Windows Update will install only servicing updates, and do so as soon as they are published by Microsoft in the Windows Update service.

segment.source: Windows Update does not install feature upgrades on devices configured for long-term servicing.
segment.target: Windows Update does not install feature upgrades on devices configured for long-term servicing.

segment.source: When devices are being managed using Windows Server Update Services, the same workflows are executed as with Windows Update except IT administrators must approve releases before installations begin.
segment.target: When devices are being managed using Windows Server Update Services, the same workflows are executed as with Windows Update except IT administrators must approve releases before installations begin.

segment.source: When using configuration management systems such as System Center Configuration Manager to manage deployments, IT administrators should make sure to obtain and deploy all servicing updates published by Microsoft as soon as possible.
segment.target: When using configuration management systems such as System Center Configuration Manager to manage deployments, IT administrators should make sure to obtain and deploy all servicing updates published by Microsoft as soon as possible.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It is important to note again that not all feature upgrades will have an LTSB.
segment.target: It is important to note again that not all feature upgrades will have an LTSB.

segment.source: The initial release of Windows 10, published in July 2015, has an LTSB and Microsoft expects to designate one additional feature upgrade in the next 12 months for long-term support.
segment.target: The initial release of Windows 10, published in July 2015, has an LTSB and Microsoft expects to designate one additional feature upgrade in the next 12 months for long-term support.

segment.source: After that, Microsoft expects to publish feature upgrades with long-term servicing support approximately every two to three years.
segment.target: After that, Microsoft expects to publish feature upgrades with long-term servicing support approximately every two to three years.

segment.source: Microsoft will provide additional information in advance of publishing new feature upgrades so that IT administrators can make informed deployment planning decisions.
segment.target: Microsoft will provide additional information in advance of publishing new feature upgrades so that IT administrators can make informed deployment planning decisions.

segment.source: Considerations when configuring devices for servicing updates only Before deciding to configure a device for LTSB-based servicing, IT administrators should carefully consider the implications of changing to a different servicing option later, and the effect of using Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB on the availability of in-box applications.
segment.target: Considerations when configuring devices for servicing updates only Before deciding to configure a device for LTSB-based servicing, IT administrators should carefully consider the implications of changing to a different servicing option later, and the effect of using Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB on the availability of in-box applications.

segment.source: Regarding edition changes, it is possible to reconfigure a device running Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB to run Windows 10 Enterprise while preserving the data and applications already on the device.
segment.target: Regarding edition changes, it is possible to reconfigure a device running Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB to run Windows 10 Enterprise while preserving the data and applications already on the device.

segment.source: Reconfiguring a device running Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB to run other editions of Windows 10 may require IT administrators to restore data and/or reinstall applications on the device after the other edition has been installed.
segment.target: Reconfiguring a device running Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB to run other editions of Windows 10 may require IT administrators to restore data and/or reinstall applications on the device after the other edition has been installed.

segment.source: Regarding in-box applications, Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB does not include all the universal apps that are included with other Windows 10 editions.
segment.target: Regarding in-box applications, Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB does not include all the universal apps that are included with other Windows 10 editions.

segment.source: This is because the universal apps included with Windows 10 will be continually upgraded by Microsoft, and new releases of in-box universal apps are unlikely to remain compatible with a feature upgrade of Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB for the duration of its servicing lifetime.
segment.target: This is because the universal apps included with Windows 10 will be continually upgraded by Microsoft, and new releases of in-box universal apps are unlikely to remain compatible with a feature upgrade of Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB for the duration of its servicing lifetime.

segment.source: Examples of apps that Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB does not include are Microsoft Edge, Windows Store Client, Cortana (limited search capabilities remain available), Outlook Mail, Outlook Calendar, OneNote, Weather, News, Sports, Money, Photos, Camera, Music, and Clock.
segment.target: Examples of apps that Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB does not include are Microsoft Edge, Windows Store Client, Cortana (limited search capabilities remain available), Outlook Mail, Outlook Calendar, OneNote, Weather, News, Sports, Money, Photos, Camera, Music, and Clock.

segment.source: Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB does include Internet Explorer 11, and is compatible with Windows 32 versions of Microsoft Office.
segment.target: Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB does include Internet Explorer 11, and is compatible with Windows 32 versions of Microsoft Office.

segment.source: IT administrators can also install universal apps on devices when apps are compatible with the feature upgrades running on the device.
segment.target: IT administrators can also install universal apps on devices when apps are compatible with the feature upgrades running on the device.

segment.source: They should do so with care, however, as servicing updates targeted for devices running Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB will not include security or non-security fixes for universal apps.
segment.target: They should do so with care, however, as servicing updates targeted for devices running Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB will not include security or non-security fixes for universal apps.

segment.source: Additionally, Microsoft will not provide servicing updates for specific releases of apps on any Windows 10 edition after the feature upgrade of Windows 10 with which the apps were included reaches the end of its servicing lifetime.
segment.target: Additionally, Microsoft will not provide servicing updates for specific releases of apps on any Windows 10 edition after the feature upgrade of Windows 10 with which the apps were included reaches the end of its servicing lifetime.
